arm_group.description: wash-in using O2:N2O 1:1 L/min with desflurane 12%

brief_summary.textblock:
We propose a new wash-in technique for desflurane low flow anesthesia with fresh gas flow of
      O2:N2O 1:1 L/min with desfluraene 12%.

      The objective of this study is to identify time to achieve alveolar concentration of
      desflurane at1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6%.

clinical_study.brief_title: 1-1-12 Wash-in for Desflurane Low Flow Anesthesia

detailed_description.textblock:
The benefits of low flow anesthesia are economic, less pollution,  more heat and humidity
      preservation but it requires appropriate wash-in phase. The current wash-in protocols are
      complicated and time consuming. We propose a new 1-1-12 desflurane wash-in protocol which is
      more simple and predictable.

      The objective of this study is to identify time to achieve alveolar concentration of
      desflurane at 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6% with 1-1-12 wash-in protocol.

      All patients will receive iv propofol 2 mg/kg as induction agent and succinyl choline 1.5
      mg/kg for intubation. Then the ventilation will be controlled to achieve end-tidal CO2 30-35
      mmHg with O2:N2O 1:1 L/min with desflurane 12%. Time to achieve alveolar concentration of
      desflurane at 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6% will be recorded and analyzed. After that, the
      concentration of desflurane and anesthetic technique will be adjusted to requirement of
      anesthesiologist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ASA classification I-II

          -  age 18-64 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  BMI > 35

          -  contraindicated for N2O

          -  with pulmonary or cardiac disease

study_pop.textblock:
patients undergoing general anesthesia with endotracheal intubation and controlled
        ventilation

intervention.description: wash-in phase during start of low flow anesthesia

clinical_study.official_title: 1-1-12 Wash-in for Desflurane Low Flow Anesthesia

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine, Khon Kaen University

oversight_info.authority: Thailand: Khon Kaen University Ethics Committee for Human Research

primary_outcome.measure: Time (in second) to achieve alveolar concentration of desflurane 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6%
primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed until alveolar concentration of desflurane reaches 6%, as expected of 15 minutes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed until alveolar concentration of desflurane reaches 6%, as expected of 15 minutes

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
